page.title: 17Citizens Rights, Fraserburgh
page.content: { Fraserburgh Citizens Rights Advice {Service}was{started in 1977}at a public meeting, and with training arranged by the Workers Education Service. The Service is now manned by a{rota {of 12 volunteers}on two mornings and one evening per week , plus a {fortnightly legal clinic. The volunteers offer{free {confidential advice}on any subject, often helping clients in their dealings with local and central government agencies. The service has helped many hundreds of people with their problems over the years and its existence has influenced people to open similar services in other locations in the north-east of Scotland.
